page.title: 09WILTS/DORSET PLOUGHING MATCH
page.content: Farmers from Wiltshire and Dorset gather annually in October for the Salisbury and District Agricultural Club's Ploughing Match, which was held this year at Manor Farm, Winterbourne Stoke. Competition was keen and the various classes included: 3 to 6 furrow ploughs, champion, vintage and shire horse classes. The Best: Ploughman, Club Member, Strike Out, Finish Off and Under 21. Best Work with: Massey Ferguson, Leyland, International, David Brown, Ford, John Deere, Randsome and Kverneland tractors. Grain Sample Contest: Milling Oats, Soft and Hard Milling Wheat, Feed Wheat and Barley and Malting Barley. Competitors from 70 farms competed. Over 100 acres of land was ploughed, using machinery worth Â£1/2 million.
